snippet: Linda E. McMahon, a Republican making her second bid for a Senate seat in Connecticut, has put a great deal of time, energy and money into softening her image among female voters.
abstract: Linda E McMahon, Republican making her second bid for Senate in Connecticut, has put a great deal of time, energy and money into softening her image among female voters, group that opposed her by a margin of 19 percent in 2010; polls show McMahon in a dead heat with her opponent, Rep Christopher S Murphy, who continues to lead by about six points among women voters.
lead_paragraph: Linda E. McMahon, a Republican making her second bid for a Senate seat in Connecticut, has put a great deal of time, energy and money into softening her image among female voters.

headline.seo: In Connecticut Senate Race, McMahon Fights for Female Votes
headline.main: For Woman in Senate Race, Uphill Fight for Female Votes
headline.print_headline: For Woman in Senate Race, Uphill Fight for Female Votes
